canonical_explanation.text: Food contains six main components: carbohydrates (for energy), proteins (for growth and repair), fats (for energy storage and insulation), vitamins (for various body functions), minerals (for strong bones, blood, and other functions), and water (for all body processes). Roughage (fiber) is also important for digestion. Vitamins include A (eyes), B (energy), C (healing), and D (bones). Important minerals include calcium (bones), iron (blood), and iodine (thyroid). A balanced diet contains all nutrients in proper amounts. Deficiency diseases occur when specific nutrients are lacking: night blindness (Vitamin A), beriberi (Vitamin B1), scurvy (Vitamin C), rickets (Vitamin D), anemia (iron), and goiter (iodine).
rules: Carbohydrates are the main source of energy
Proteins are needed for growth and repair of body tissues
Vitamins regulate body functions and prevent diseases
Minerals are needed for bones, blood, and other body functions
Water is essential for all life processes
A balanced diet contains all nutrients in proper proportions
Deficiency diseases result from lack of specific nutrients

questions.question_text: How many main components are there in food?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Six. Food contains six main components: carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. These are the essential nutrients that our body needs to function properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) Six. While the other options (four, five, or seven) may sound plausible, food actually contains six main components that are crucial for our health and well-being. These are carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water.

questions.question_text: Which nutrient is the main source of energy for our body?
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates are the main source of energy for our body. They are broken down into glucose, which is then used by our cells to produce energy in the form of ATP.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Proteins, vitamins, and minerals are all important nutrients, but they are not the main source of energy for our body. Proteins are used for growth and repair, vitamins help various body functions, and minerals are important for strong bones and blood. Carbohydrates, on the other hand, are the primary source of energy that our body uses to power all its activities.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a source of carbohydrates?
questions.explanation_correct: Rice is a good source of carbohydrates, which provide energy for the body. Carbohydrates are one of the main nutrients found in food, along with proteins, fats, vitamins, and minerals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eggs, fish, and butter are not sources of carbohydrates. Carbohydrates are found in foods like rice, bread, pasta, fruits, and vegetables. These provide the body with the energy it needs to function properly.

questions.question_text: Which nutrient is called the body-building food?
questions.explanation_correct: Proteins are called the body-building food because they are essential for the growth and repair of all body tissues, such as muscles, organs, and skin. Proteins help build and maintain the structure of the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Carbohydrates provide energy to the body, fats store energy and insulate the body, and vitamins help the body function properly. However, proteins are the true body-building nutrients as they are needed to grow and repair all body tissues. Proteins are made up of building blocks called amino acids that are used to build and maintain muscles, organs, and other parts of the body.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is rich in proteins?
questions.explanation_correct: Pulses like dal (lentils) are a great source of proteins, which are important for our growth and repair of body tissues. Proteins help build and maintain our muscles, skin, and other body parts.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Potatoes, rice, and sugar do not contain much protein. Potatoes and rice are mainly made up of carbohydrates, which provide us with energy. Sugar is also a carbohydrate and does not have proteins. Pulses like dal are the correct answer because they are rich in proteins that our body needs for growth and development.

questions.question_text: Fats provide more energy than carbohydrates and also:
questions.explanation_correct: Fats provide more energy than carbohydrates and also store energy in the body and provide insulation, which is why option B is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fats do not build muscles, which is the role of proteins. Fats also do not prevent diseases, as that is the role of a balanced diet and a healthy lifestyle. Fats also do not help with digestion, which is the role of fiber and other nutrients.

questions.question_text: Which vitamin is essential for healthy eyes?
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamin A is essential for healthy eyes. It helps the eyes adjust to low light and prevents a condition called night blindness, where a person has difficulty seeing in the dark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamin B, C, and D are important for other bodily functions, but they are not specifically responsible for maintaining healthy eyes. Vitamin A is the vitamin that is essential for good eyesight and preventing night blindness.

questions.question_text: Which vitamin is found in citrus fruits like oranges and lemons?
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamin C is found in citrus fruits like oranges and lemons. This vitamin is important for healing wounds and keeping the body healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Vitamin C, not Vitamin A, B, or D, is the vitamin found in citrus fruits. Vitamin C helps the body fight infections and heal cuts and bruises. It is an important nutrient that we get from fruits and vegetables.

questions.question_text: Sunlight helps our body produce which vitamin?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) Vitamin D. Sunlight helps our body produce vitamin D, which is important for strong and healthy bones.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect. Vitamin A is important for good eyesight, vitamin B helps our body convert food into energy, and vitamin C helps our body heal wounds. However, sunlight specifically helps our body produce vitamin D, which is needed for strong and healthy bones.

questions.question_text: Which mineral is needed for strong bones and teeth?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is calcium because calcium is a mineral that is essential for building strong bones and teeth. It helps to keep our bones and teeth healthy and strong.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is calcium, not iron, iodine, or sodium. Iron is important for making red blood cells, iodine is important for the thyroid gland, and sodium helps to regulate the body's fluid balance. However, calcium is the specific mineral that is needed for strong bones and teeth.

questions.question_text: Iron is needed for making:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Hemoglobin in blood. Iron is an important mineral that is needed to make hemoglobin, the red pigment in our blood that helps carry oxygen throughout the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because: A) Strong bones - Calcium, not iron, is the main mineral needed for strong bones. C) Healthy skin - Vitamins like A and C are more important for skin health. D) Good eyesight - Vitamin A is the main nutrient needed for good eyesight.

questions.question_text: Water makes up about what percentage of our body weight?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 70%. Our bodies are made up of a large amount of water, which accounts for around 70% of our total body weight. This is because water is essential for many important processes in the body, such as circulation, digestion, and temperature regulation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because water does not make up 30%, 50%, or 90% of our body weight. While some people may have a slightly higher or lower water content, the average person's body is made up of about 70% water. The other options are too low or too high to accurately represent the typical water composition of the human body.

questions.question_text: Roughage (fiber) is found in:
questions.explanation_correct: Roughage, also called fiber, is found in plant-based foods like vegetables and whole grains. This is because fiber is a type of carbohydrate that our bodies cannot digest, and it helps to keep our digestive system healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roughage is not found in meat, eggs, milk, cheese, oil, or butter. These foods are made up of other nutrients like proteins, fats, and vitamins, but they do not contain fiber. The correct answer is vegetables and whole grains, which are plant-based foods that are high in fiber.

questions.question_text: A diet that contains all nutrients in proper amounts is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet contains all the different nutrients like carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and fiber in the right amounts. This ensures your body gets everything it needs to stay healthy and grow properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A simple diet only has a few types of foods, while a heavy or light diet refers to the quantity of food, not the nutrients in it. A balanced diet is the best choice because it provides all the necessary nutrients your body needs in the right proportions.

questions.question_text: The disease caused by lack of Vitamin C is:
questions.explanation_correct: The disease caused by lack of Vitamin C is scurvy. Vitamin C is important for the body to heal wounds and keep the gums and skin healthy. Without enough Vitamin C, a person can develop scurvy, which causes bleeding gums, loose teeth, and skin problems.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The disease caused by lack of Vitamin C is scurvy, not rickets, night blindness, or beriberi. Rickets is caused by a lack of Vitamin D, which is important for strong bones. Night blindness is caused by a lack of Vitamin A, which is important for good eyesight. Beriberi is caused by a lack of Vitamin B1, which is important for energy production.

questions.question_text: A child is not able to see properly in dim light. This could be due to lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) Vitamin A. Vitamin A is important for good vision, especially in dim light. A lack of Vitamin A can cause night blindness, where a person has trouble seeing in the dark or in low light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because they do not relate to vision problems. Vitamin B is important for energy, Vitamin C is important for healing, and Vitamin D is important for strong bones. A lack of these vitamins would not specifically cause night blindness or trouble seeing in dim light.

questions.question_text: A person has weak bones that bend easily. This could be due to lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Vitamin D. Vitamin D is important for strong bones and teeth. It helps the body absorb calcium, which is a mineral that makes bones hard and strong. Without enough Vitamin D, the bones become weak and can bend easily, a condition called rickets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because they do not relate to weak and bending bones. Vitamin A is important for good vision, Vitamin B helps the body convert food into energy, and Vitamin C is important for healing wounds. None of these vitamins are directly linked to the issue of weak bones that can easily bend.

questions.question_text: Goiter (enlarged thyroid gland) is caused by deficiency of:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Iodine. Goiter is caused by a lack of iodine in the diet. Iodine is an important mineral that helps the thyroid gland function properly. Without enough iodine, the thyroid gland becomes enlarged, leading to the condition called goiter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect. Deficiency of iron causes anemia, not goiter. Calcium deficiency leads to weak bones and rickets, not goiter. Vitamin D deficiency also causes rickets, but not goiter. Only iodine deficiency specifically leads to the development of an enlarged thyroid gland, which is the condition known as goiter.

questions.question_text: A growing child needs more of which nutrient compared to an adult?
questions.explanation_correct: A growing child needs more proteins compared to an adult because proteins are essential for growth and development, helping the body build and repair tissues like muscles, bones, and organs. Growing children need a higher amount of proteins to support their rapid physical growth and development.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A growing child does not need more fats, carbohydrates, or roughage compared to an adult. Fats and carbohydrates provide energy, but a growing child's main nutritional need is for proteins to support their rapid growth and development. Roughage, or dietary fiber, is important for digestion but is not the primary nutrient a growing child requires more of compared to an adult.

questions.question_text: Why is roughage important even though it does not provide nutrients?

options.text: It helps in digestion and prevents constipation

questions.explanation_correct: Roughage, or dietary fiber, helps in digestion and prevents constipation. It adds bulk to the stool and helps food move through the intestines smoothly, improving bowel movements.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roughage does not provide energy, build muscles, or help with vision. While it is important for overall health, it is specifically crucial for good digestion and preventing constipation. Roughage adds bulk to the stool and helps food move through the intestines, which is why it is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Eating too many sweets can lead to:
questions.explanation_correct: Eating too many sweets can lead to tooth decay and obesity. Sweets contain a lot of sugar, which can damage your teeth and cause them to rot. Eating too many sweets can also make you gain too much weight, leading to obesity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating too many sweets does not lead to strong bones or better eyesight. Sweets do not provide the nutrients needed for strong bones or good eyesight. Instead, they can lead to tooth decay and weight gain, which is why option B is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: An athlete needs more of which nutrient before a race?
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates are the main source of energy for the body, so an athlete needs more carbohydrates before a race to have the energy to run quickly and perform well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the best choices for an athlete before a race. Vitamins and minerals are important for overall health, but they don't provide the immediate energy boost that carbohydrates do. Roughage (fiber) is good for digestion, but it doesn't directly provide the energy an athlete needs right before a race.

questions.question_text: A person feels tired and weak, and has pale skin. This could be due to lack of:
questions.explanation_correct: The person's symptoms of feeling tired, weak, and having pale skin are likely due to a lack of iron in their diet. Iron is an important mineral that helps make red blood cells, which carry oxygen throughout the body. Without enough iron, the body cannot produce enough red blood cells, leading to anemia and the symptoms described.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The person's symptoms are not due to a lack of Vitamin C, Calcium, or Vitamin D. Vitamin C helps with wound healing and immune function, Calcium is important for strong bones, and Vitamin D helps the body absorb Calcium. While deficiencies in these nutrients can cause other health issues, the pale skin and feelings of tiredness and weakness are specifically linked to a lack of iron, which is needed to make red blood cells.

questions.question_text: We should drink plenty of water because:

options.text: It helps transport nutrients and remove waste

questions.explanation_correct: We should drink plenty of water because it helps transport nutrients to all parts of the body and remove waste products from the body. This is important for keeping our body healthy and functioning properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While water does not directly provide energy, vitamins, or build muscles, it is very important for many body processes. Water helps carry nutrients and oxygen to all the cells in our body and also removes waste products. This is why we need to drink plenty of water every day to stay healthy.

questions.question_text: A sailor on a long voyage develops bleeding gums and weakness. The most likely cause is deficiency of:
questions.explanation_correct: The most likely cause of the sailor's bleeding gums and weakness is a deficiency of Vitamin C. Vitamin C is important for healing and prevents a disease called scurvy, which causes bleeding gums and overall weakness.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other vitamins (A, B, and D) are not the correct answer here. Vitamin A is important for vision, Vitamin B is important for energy, and Vitamin D is important for strong bones. However, the symptoms of bleeding gums and weakness are specifically caused by a lack of Vitamin C, which leads to the disease scurvy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following meals is most balanced?

options.text: Rice, dal, vegetable curry, salad, and curd

questions.explanation_correct: Option A is the most balanced meal because it contains a variety of nutrients like carbohydrates (rice), proteins (dal), vitamins and minerals (vegetable curry and salad), and probiotics (curd). This combination provides the body with all the necessary nutrients for growth, energy, and overall health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B (rice only) is not a balanced meal because it lacks important nutrients like proteins, vitamins, and minerals. Option C (fried chips and candy) is also not balanced as it is high in unhealthy fats and sugars, but lacks essential nutrients. Option D (just fruits) is also not a complete meal as it does not provide enough calories and other nutrients the body needs.

questions.question_text: Why is iodized salt recommended?

options.text: It prevents goiter caused by iodine deficiency

questions.explanation_correct: Iodized salt is recommended because it helps prevent goiter, a disease caused by lack of iodine in the diet. Iodine is an important mineral that the body needs for healthy thyroid function. Adding iodine to salt ensures that people get enough of this essential nutrient.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the reasons why iodized salt is recommended. Iodized salt does not taste better than regular salt, nor does it provide calcium or energy. The main reason iodized salt is recommended is to prevent iodine deficiency and the disease called goiter.

questions.question_text: Kwashiorkor is a disease caused by severe deficiency of:
questions.explanation_correct: Kwashiorkor is a disease caused by severe deficiency of proteins. Proteins are essential for growth and repair of the body, and a lack of proteins leads to this nutritional deficiency disease.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kwashiorkor is not caused by a deficiency of vitamins, carbohydrates, or fats. It is specifically caused by a lack of proteins in the diet. Proteins are the building blocks of the body and are necessary for growth and development. Without adequate proteins, the body cannot function properly, leading to the symptoms of kwashiorkor.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a source of fats?
questions.explanation_correct: Butter is a source of fats, which are nutrients that provide energy and insulation for our bodies. Fats are found in many foods like butter, oils, and fatty meats.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rice, apples, and spinach are sources of carbohydrates, vitamins, and minerals, respectively, but not fats. Fats are an important nutrient that provides energy and insulation, and can be found in foods like butter, oils, and fatty meats.

questions.question_text: Carrots are good for eyesight because they contain:
questions.explanation_correct: Carrots are good for eyesight because they contain Vitamin A, which is important for maintaining healthy eyes and good vision.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Carrots do not contain Vitamin C, iron, or calcium. These nutrients are important for other bodily functions, but they are not the reason why carrots are good for eyesight. Carrots contain a high amount of Vitamin A, which is the nutrient that helps keep eyes healthy and improves vision.

questions.question_text: Carbohydrates are the main source of energy for our body.
questions.explanation_correct: Carbohydrates are the main source of energy for our body. They provide the fuel that our cells need to function and give us the energy to move, think, and do our daily activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students may think that proteins or fats are the main source of energy for our body. However, carbohydrates are the primary source of energy that our body uses. Proteins and fats are important for other functions, like growth and insulation, but they are not the main energy sources.

questions.question_text: Proteins help in growth and repair of body tissues.
questions.explanation_correct: Proteins are one of the main components of our food. They help in the growth and repair of body tissues, which is why the answer 'true' is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Proteins do not just provide energy, they also play an important role in helping our body grow and repair tissues. If the body does not get enough proteins, it will not be able to grow properly and maintain its tissues. That is why the statement 'Proteins help in growth and repair of body tissues' is true.

questions.question_text: Vitamin D is found in sunlight.
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamin D is produced in the skin when it is exposed to sunlight. This is why vitamin D is called the 'sunshine vitamin'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people may think that vitamin D comes from food, but it is actually produced naturally in the body when the skin is exposed to sunlight. Vitamin D helps the body absorb calcium and is important for strong bones and teeth.

questions.question_text: Iron deficiency causes rickets.
questions.explanation_correct: Iron deficiency causes anemia, not rickets. Rickets is caused by a lack of vitamin D, which is important for strong bones. Iron is needed for the blood, not for bone health.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rickets is caused by a lack of vitamin D, which is important for the development and strength of bones. Iron deficiency leads to anemia, which is a problem with the blood, not the bones. So iron deficiency does not cause rickets.

questions.question_text: Roughage provides energy to the body.
questions.explanation_correct: Roughage, or fiber, does not provide energy to the body. Roughage is important for digestion, as it helps move food through the intestines, but it is not used by the body as an energy source like carbohydrates, proteins, and fats.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Roughage, or fiber, is not a source of energy for the body. Carbohydrates, proteins, and fats are the main nutrients that provide energy to the body. Roughage helps with digestion, but it does not get broken down to release energy. The body uses carbohydrates, proteins, and fats as its primary energy sources.

questions.question_text: Scurvy is caused by deficiency of Vitamin C.
questions.explanation_correct: Scurvy is caused by the deficiency of Vitamin C in the body. Vitamin C is important for the body to make collagen, which helps repair and strengthen blood vessels, bones, and skin. Without enough Vitamin C, the body cannot properly heal and repair itself, leading to the symptoms of scurvy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scurvy is not caused by the deficiency of any other vitamin. It is specifically caused by the lack of Vitamin C in the diet. Vitamins like A, B, and D are important for other functions in the body, but they do not prevent or cure scurvy. Only getting enough Vitamin C can treat and prevent the symptoms of scurvy.

questions.question_text: Water helps in regulating body temperature.
questions.explanation_correct: Water is important for regulating body temperature. When the body gets too hot, water helps cool it down through sweating. The evaporation of sweat from the skin helps lower the body's temperature.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students may think that water does not help regulate body temperature, but this is not correct. Water is essential for many body processes, including maintaining the right temperature. When the body gets too hot, water helps cool it down through sweating, which lowers the body's temperature.

questions.question_text: A balanced diet contains only proteins and carbohydrates.
questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet contains not just proteins and carbohydrates, but all six main components of food - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. A diet that is missing important nutrients like vitamins and minerals would not be considered balanced.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A balanced diet contains all six main components of food - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. It is not just proteins and carbohydrates. Vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients are also essential for good health and should be included in a balanced diet.

questions.question_text: Night blindness is caused by deficiency of Vitamin A.
questions.explanation_correct: Night blindness is caused by a deficiency of Vitamin A. Vitamin A is important for eye health, and a lack of it leads to difficulty seeing in the dark or in low light conditions, which is called night blindness.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Night blindness is not caused by a deficiency of any other vitamin. Vitamin A is specifically needed for the proper functioning of the eyes, and a lack of it leads to night blindness. Other vitamins and minerals like Vitamin B, C, or iron do not cause this condition.

questions.question_text: Fats provide more energy per gram than carbohydrates.
questions.explanation_correct: Fats do provide more energy per gram than carbohydrates. This is because fats have a higher energy content compared to carbohydrates. One gram of fat provides 9 calories of energy, while one gram of carbohydrate provides only 4 calories.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Carbohydrates do not provide more energy per gram than fats. This is a common misconception. In fact, fats have a higher energy content and provide more calories per gram compared to carbohydrates. One gram of fat provides 9 calories, while one gram of carbohydrate provides only 4 calories. Therefore, the statement that 'fats provide more energy per gram than carbohydrates' is true.

questions.question_text: Rice, bread, and potatoes are rich sources of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Rice, bread, and potatoes are all foods that are rich in carbohydrates. Carbohydrates are one of the six main components of food, and they provide energy for the body to function properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'carbohydrates'. Rice, bread, and potatoes are all starchy foods that are high in carbohydrates, which the body uses as its main source of energy. They are not rich sources of proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, or water, which are the other main components of food.

questions.question_text: _____ are called body-building foods.
questions.explanation_correct: Proteins are called body-building foods because they help in the growth and repair of our body tissues. They are important for building and maintaining muscles, bones, and other organs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Proteins'. Proteins are the nutrients that help in the growth and development of our body. They are not used primarily for energy like carbohydrates, but they help build and repair our body tissues. The other nutrients like carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals have different functions in the body.

questions.question_text: Vitamin _____ is needed for healthy eyes.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is Vitamin A. Vitamin A is important for keeping our eyes healthy and allowing us to see in the dark, which is why it is needed for healthy eyes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'A'. The correct answer is Vitamin A. Vitamin A is important for maintaining good vision and eye health. It helps the cornea, the clear front part of the eye, stay healthy. Without enough Vitamin A, a person can develop night blindness, where they have trouble seeing in the dark.

questions.question_text: Vitamin _____ is needed for strong bones and is produced when we are exposed to sunlight.
questions.explanation_correct: Vitamin D is needed for strong and healthy bones. Our body can produce Vitamin D when our skin is exposed to sunlight, so getting enough sun exposure is important for having strong bones.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Vitamin D. Vitamin D is important for building strong bones and teeth. It is produced in our skin when we are exposed to sunlight. The other vitamins like A, B, and C are also important for different functions in the body, but Vitamin D is specifically needed for bone health.

questions.question_text: _____ is a mineral needed for making hemoglobin in blood.
questions.explanation_correct: Iron is a mineral that is needed to make hemoglobin, the substance in red blood cells that carries oxygen around the body. Hemoglobin gives blood its red color, and it is essential for transporting oxygen to all the cells in the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Iron'. Iron is a mineral that is necessary for making hemoglobin, the red substance in our blood that carries oxygen. Without enough iron, our body cannot produce enough hemoglobin, which can lead to a condition called anemia. Other minerals like calcium and iodine are important for other functions in the body, but iron is specifically needed for the blood.

questions.question_text: Milk is rich in _____, which is needed for strong bones and teeth.
questions.explanation_correct: Milk is a great source of calcium, which is an important mineral needed for building and maintaining strong bones and teeth in our bodies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'calcium'. Milk contains high amounts of calcium, which is essential for the growth and development of strong bones and teeth. Other nutrients in milk, like proteins and vitamins, are also important for overall health, but calcium is the key nutrient that makes milk a great food for bone strength.

questions.question_text: A disease caused by lack of Vitamin C is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The disease caused by lack of Vitamin C is called scurvy. Vitamin C is important for healing wounds and keeping gums and teeth healthy, so a lack of it leads to the condition called scurvy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is scurvy. Scurvy is a disease that occurs when there is not enough Vitamin C in the body. Vitamin C is important for many body functions, including healing wounds and keeping gums and teeth healthy. If you don't get enough Vitamin C, you can develop scurvy, which causes symptoms like bleeding gums, loose teeth, and slow healing of cuts and bruises.

questions.question_text: Weak and bent bones in children due to lack of Vitamin D is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'rickets'. Rickets is a disease caused by a lack of Vitamin D, which is important for strong and healthy bones. Without enough Vitamin D, children's bones become weak and bent, leading to the condition called rickets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'rickets'. Rickets is not the same as other deficiency diseases like night blindness (lack of Vitamin A), anemia (lack of iron), or goiter (lack of iodine). Rickets is specifically caused by a lack of Vitamin D, which is needed for strong and healthy bones. This leads to weak and bent bones in children.

questions.question_text: _____ (fiber) helps in proper digestion of food.
questions.explanation_correct: Roughage, also called fiber, is important for proper digestion of food. It helps to move food through the digestive system and keep the intestines healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Roughage'. Roughage, or fiber, is an important part of a balanced diet. It helps food move through the digestive system smoothly and prevents constipation. Without enough roughage, the digestive process would not work properly.

questions.question_text: A diet that contains all nutrients in proper amounts is called a _____ diet.
questions.explanation_correct: A balanced diet is the right answer because it contains all the necessary nutrients - carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water - in the proper amounts for your body to be healthy and function well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A 'balanced' diet is not the same as a 'complete' or 'full' diet. A balanced diet means that it has the right amounts of all the different nutrients your body needs, not just that it contains all the different types of nutrients. The accepted answer format is 'balanced'.

questions.question_text: Enlarged thyroid gland (goiter) is caused by deficiency of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Enlarged thyroid gland, or goiter, is caused by a deficiency of the mineral iodine in the diet. Iodine is essential for the proper functioning of the thyroid gland, which controls growth and metabolism. Without enough iodine, the thyroid gland becomes enlarged as it tries to compensate and produce more hormones.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is iodine. Iodine is an important mineral that the body needs for the proper functioning of the thyroid gland. When there is not enough iodine in the diet, the thyroid gland becomes enlarged, which is the condition called goiter. Other nutrient deficiencies like vitamin A, B, C, or D do not cause goiter.

questions.question_text: Deficiency of iron causes _____, a condition where blood has less hemoglobin.
questions.explanation_correct: Deficiency of iron leads to a condition called anemia, where the blood has less hemoglobin. Hemoglobin is the protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen around the body. Without enough iron, the body cannot produce enough hemoglobin, causing anemia.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'anemia'. Anemia is the correct answer because it is a medical condition caused by iron deficiency, where the blood has less hemoglobin. Other nutrient deficiencies can cause different diseases, but the question specifically asks about the effect of iron deficiency.

questions.question_text: Arrange the nutrients by their main function (energy, growth, protection):
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Carbohydrates (energy), Proteins (growth), and Vitamins (protection) because carbohydrates provide the body with energy, proteins help the body grow and repair itself, and vitamins protect the body by supporting various functions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Vitamins (protection), Carbohydrates (energy), Proteins (growth). This is wrong because vitamins are not the main source of energy for the body - that is the role of carbohydrates. Proteins are responsible for growth and repair, not energy. The correct order places the nutrients in their primary functions.

questions.question_text: Arrange by energy content per gram (lowest to highest):
questions.explanation_correct: Proteins have the lowest energy content per gram at 4 calories, followed by carbohydrates at 4 calories, and then fats at 9 calories per gram. This is why the order from lowest to highest energy content is Proteins, Carbohydrates, Fats.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Carbohydrates, Proteins, Fats. This is incorrect because carbohydrates and proteins both have 4 calories per gram, while fats have 9 calories per gram, so fats have the highest energy content per gram out of the three.

questions.question_text: Arrange vitamins A, B, C, D in alphabetical order:
questions.explanation_correct: The vitamins are arranged in alphabetical order: Vitamin A, Vitamin B, Vitamin C, Vitamin D. This is the correct order because the names start with the letters A, B, C, and D, respectively, in alphabetical sequence.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The vitamins are not arranged in alphabetical order. The correct order should be Vitamin A, Vitamin B, Vitamin C, Vitamin D. This is because the names start with the letters A, B, C, and D, respectively, in alphabetical sequence.

questions.question_text: Arrange the path of food through the body:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Eating, Digestion, Absorption because this is the path food takes through the body. First, you eat the food. Then, the digestive system breaks down the food into smaller nutrients. Finally, these nutrients are absorbed into the bloodstream so they can be used by the body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Digestion, Absorption, Eating. This is wrong because you need to eat the food first before it can be digested and absorbed. The correct order is Eating, where you take in the food, then Digestion, where your body breaks down the food, and finally Absorption, where the nutrients from the food are taken into your bloodstream to be used by your body.

questions.question_text: Arrange by water content (lowest to highest):
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is correct because fruits and vegetables have the highest water content, followed by cooked rice, and then dry grains like wheat or rice which have the lowest water content.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order from lowest to highest water content is: Dry grains, Cooked rice, Fruits and vegetables. Dry grains like wheat or rice have very low water content since the moisture has been removed. Cooked rice has more water than dry grains because it absorbs water during the cooking process. Fruits and vegetables naturally have the highest water content, often over 90% water.
